power.title: Always Falling Rage
power.fluff: The fury of the waterfall and the relentless push of water propels you past any defenses

element.text: If you are already raging when you use this power, you can choose to either change your rage to Always Falling Rage or to shift one-half your speed.

element.name: Hit:
element.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier, and you knock the target prone.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you can use an opportunity reaction to shift 2 squares when an ally hits an enemy adjacent to you.
Additionally, on your turn you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against adjacent targets that were not adjacent to you at the start of your turn and you knock such targets prone on a critical hit.

power.title: Bloodhunt Rage
power.fluff: Your rage surges up from the depths of your pain to bring pain to the wounded

element.text: If you are already raging when you use this power, you can choose to either change your rage to Bloodhunt Rage or to reroll any 1s on your damage roll for this power.
If the target is bloodied, you deal additional damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a bonus equal to your Constitution modifier to the damage rolls of melee and close attacks with the Weapon keyword if either you or the target is bloodied.
This stacks with the additional damage this power deals against a bloodied target.

power.title: Bloodseeker Drake Rage
power.fluff: As you strike, flashes of spectral teeth and blood-red scales reveal the bloodseeker drake's spirit that inspires your rage

element.text: If you are already raging when you use this power, you can choose to either change your rage to Bloodseeker Drake Rage or to increase the attack roll bonus against a bloodied target to +4 instead of +2.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack if the target is bloodied
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against bloodied targets.
In addition, you can use an immediate interrupt to make a barbarian at-will attack against a bloodied enemy that shifts or provokes an opportunity attack.

power.title: Blood Bear Rage
power.fluff: You strike, then call on the spirit of the blood bear, drawing on its great strength and crushing grip to destroy your foes

element.text: If you are already raging when you use this power, you can choose to either change your rage to Blood Bear Rage or to have the target take 5 + your Strength modifier damage at the start of its turn if it is still grabbed by you.

element.name: Effect:
element.text: You grab the target and can maintain the grab with your weapon instead of a free hand if you wish.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +4 bonus to grab attack rolls and to checks and defenses against escape attempts.
Also, if an enemy starts its turn grabbed by you, it takes damage equal to 5 + your Strength modifier.
In additiona, you can use an immediate interrupt to negate forced movement against a creature you are grabbing or against you when you are grabbing a creature.

power.title: Macetail Behemoth Rage
power.fluff: You knock your enemy to the ground with a slam like the behemoth's heavy flail, and the rage of the macetail fills you, refreshing you with every blow of your weapon

element.text: If you are already raging when you use this power, you can choose to either change your rage to Macetail Behemoth Rage or to knock all targets prone even on a miss.

element.name: Target:
element.text: Each enemy in the burst you can see

element.name: Hit:
element.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier, and you knock the target prone.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, when a barbarian attack allows you to push a target, you can halve the distance to knock the target prone.
In additiona, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Strength modifier each time you hit with a barbarian attack power.
You gain an additional 5 temporary hit points if the target was already prone or was knocked prone by the attack.

power.title: Swift Panther Rage
power.fluff: You slash your foe with fury as the spirit of the swift panther grants you its speed and agility

element.text: If you are already raging when you use this power, you can choose to either change your rage to Swift Panther Rage or to shift 4 squares instead of 2 squares.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +2 bonus to speed and can shift 2 squares as a move action.
In additiona, when a barbarian power allows you to move or shift you can move or shift 1 additional square. This stacks with the bonus to speed when a power allows you to move your speed.
